content: The Act titled "FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017" clarifies the application date of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to deemed tobacco products. The Act clarifies the application date of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to deemed tobacco products, amending Section 901(b) by specifying the effective date for tobacco products subject to the Act's requirements. The Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act clarifies the application date for deemed tobacco products, specifying the effective date based on the FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017. SEC. 3. PRODUCT STANDARDS FOR VAPOR PRODUCT BATTERIES. Product standards for vapor product batteries will be established under section 907 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must issue proposed standards within 12 months and finalize them within 24 months of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will not require reports or treat vapor products with batteries as new tobacco products if they comply with final standards. The term "vapor product" is defined in section 921(f) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The term "vapor product" is defined in section 921(f) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. SEC. 4. REGULATION OF VAPOR PRODUCTS. Amends Chapter IX of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act by inserting a new section 921 regarding vapor products. The Secretary has additional authority to regulate vapor products, not replacing existing authorities. Advertising of vapor products in print publications is restricted to adult publications with a readership of 15% or less under 18 years of age. The sale of vapor products is restricted to face-to-face transactions, with exceptions for mail order sales and vending machines in adult-only facilities. The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017 prohibits individuals under 18 years of age from entering areas where vapor products are sold. Violations will result in civil penalties. Within 12 months of the Act's enactment, vapor product packages must include labels stating "Keep Out of Reach of Children" and "Underage Sale Prohibited," with additional labeling required for products containing nicotine. The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017 requires vapor products to have accurate nicotine content labels. Retailers must register their establishments with the Secretary within specific timeframes. The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017 mandates accurate nicotine labeling for vapor products. Retailers must register their establishments with the Secretary, and the requirements do not apply to establishments with active registrations or licenses under state laws or section 905. The Secretary must provide public access to registration information upon request. A vapor product is defined as a noncombustible product that uses various means to produce vapor from nicotine. The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017 requires accurate nicotine labeling for vapor products, which are noncombustible products intended to produce vapor from nicotine. The term "vapor product" includes electronic cigarettes, cigars, cigarillos, pipes, and similar devices. The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2017 mandates accurate nicotine labeling for vapor products, including electronic cigarettes, cigars, and pipes. Section 301 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act prohibits the dissemination of misleading advertising or labeling of vapor products and requires registration for establishments selling these products.
